The largest contiguous empire in history was the British Empire, which at its peak in the mid-19th century, spanned across 20% of the world's land area, encompassing territories in every continent except Antarctica. The use of paper money dates back to ancient China during the Tang Dynasty (618-907 CE). The first paper money was called "Jiaozi" and was used for large transactions and as a substitute for copper coins. It wasn't until the 17th century that paper money became widely used in Europe.
